snippet: Li Jianli, who was attacked in Xi’an, China, for driving a Japanese car, has become a symbol of what can go wrong when latent nationalism over disputed territories spins out of control.
abstract: Xi'an Journal; Li Jianli, who lies partially paralyzed from attack in Xi’an, China, for driving Japanese car, is part of ugliest known episode among anti-Japanese protests that have convulsed cities in China after longstanding dispute over island chain erupts into fury.

byline.original: By AMY QIN and EDWARD WONG
byline.contributor: Amy Qin reported from Xi’an, and Edward Wong from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Li Jianli, who was attacked in Xi’an, China, for driving a Japanese car, has become a symbol of what can go wrong when latent nationalism over disputed territories spins out of control.

headline.seo: Beating in Xi’an for Offense of Driving Japanese Car
headline.main: Smashed Skull Serves as Grim Symbol of Seething Patriotism
headline.print_headline: Grim Symbol of Seething Patriotism: A Smashed Skull
